items.description: River Rythe from Oxshott to Thames Ditton
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding. Further isolated showers are forecast today which may cause minor surface water issues but are not expected to be as heavy or widespread as those experienced on Sunday and impacts on the rivers are considered unlikely but we will continue to monitor the situation closely. The weather remains unsettled for the rest of the week and heavy rainfall is possible which may require further alerts to be issued.

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding. Further isolated showers are forecast today which may cause minor surface water issues but are not expected to be as heavy or widespread as those experienced on Sunday and impacts on the rivers are considered unlikely but we will continue to monitor the situation closely. The weather remains unsettled for the rest of the week and heavy rainfall is possible which may require further alerts to be issued.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
    
We continue to monitor the situation.

Water levels in the Monktonmead Brook at St John’s are now falling. 

The weather will remain unsettled over the next few days. For today (Tuesday 27/07/2021) a further 5mm of rainfall is forecast, and tomorrow (Wednesday 28/07/2021) 7mm of rainfall is forecast. However, it is possible that some heavy showers, up to about 30mm for the next few days, could affect the Isle of Wight.

We will continue to monitor the river and weather forecast information. We will issue further advice if additional rainfall causes a significant rise in water level.

The water level in the Eastern Yar remains very high and is rising. Overnight 17mm of rain was recorded at Wroxall, 27mm at Knighton. The rain fell in 2 hours, and is a significant amount in a short period of time.  Today (27/07/21), flooding to land, cycle tracks and access paths will continue along the Yar Valley. At Alverstone and Langbridge, the river will reach a similar level to yesterday morning (and could rise a few cms higher). It will flood gardens, surround property, flood the main road at Alverstone, Golf Links and Moreton Common Road. Today and for the rest of this week, showers, which at times, will be heavy and slow moving, are forecast. Whilst most of the rain has currently cleared the area, further rain could impact the river today. At Alverstone, the river will rise until at least 14:00. At Sandown, it won’t peak until the early hours of Wednesday morning, rising to bank full at the main road bridge. We continue to monitor the forecast. At Alverstone and Langbridge, please take action to protect property. This message will be updated by 15:00 on Tuesday 27/07/21.

items.description: Whitwell, Wroxall, Langbridge, Alverstone on the Eastern Yar
items.message: The water level in the Eastern Yar remains very high, but it is now slowly falling. In Langbridge, Horringford and Alverstone, out of bank flooding affecting gardens, roads, access tracks and cycle paths is expected to continue over the next 18 hours. A Flood Alert will remain in force and will be updated regularly to cover these impacts. Today (Monday 26/07/21) and for the rest of this week, there is the potential for further heavy showers to develop. The river will remain incredibly sensitive to further rainfall, so should any heavy rain affect the area (especially over the next 12 hours) then we may need to issue further advice and messages.

items.description: River Beult from Pluckley and Bethersden to Hampstead Lock at Yalding
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Further thunderstorms are forecast over the next 3 days, with low confidence over exact timing and locations. 

We continue to monitor the situation. Please stay aware in case further Alerts or warnings are issued.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  River levels have now fallen at the Stapleford river gauge.  The forecast for today is for potentially scattered heavy showers, we recommend that you keep up to date with the forecast.      

We will continue to monitor the situation and provide an update if the situation changes.
